page.title: 03BLAISE HAMLET
page.content: Blaise hamlet is in Henbury near Bristol. It was built for Mr. John Harford by Mr.{John Nash}in the early nineteenth century. It was handed over to the{National Trust}by Gryphon Trustees in 1943. Mr. John Harford was a successful Bristol banker. In 1789 he bought Blaise Castle Estate. John Harford died in 1815. He saw Blaise Hamlet before he died. In 1807 it was called Greens. Blaise Hamlet now is a{very peaceful} and{charming}place. The houses are built around the Green. One house has a tree trunk supporting the porch. They have{thatched roofs}and{stone {covered chimneys.}There is a water pump in the middle of the Green. You pull a heavy handle up and water used to spurt out from a stone lion's mouth.It is used as houses for old people. St. Bedes School
